value.name: casing, cement -- circulate, cement
value.description: A specialization of 'casing, cement': circulate and cement

value.name: casing, cement -- rig up, run casing
value.description: A specialization of 'casing, cement': rig up and run casing

value.name: casing, cement -- rig up, run liner
value.description: A specialization of 'casing, cement': rig up and run liner

value.name: completion operations
value.description: After reaching total depth, any operations for completing the well and bringing it on production - no further detail is known.

value.name: completion operations -- testing
value.description: Pre-production flow testing in the well completion phase.

value.name: cond mud, circulate -- boulder or gravel
deviation survey -- dir multi-shot
value.description: A specialization of 'deviation survey': directional multi-shot

value.name: deviation survey -- dir single shot
value.description: A specialization of 'deviation survey': directional single shot

value.name: drilling -- drill cement, float equip
value.description: A specialization of 'drilling': drill out cement and/or float equipment

value.name: pressure test -- form integrity test
value.description: A specialization of 'pressure test': formation integrity test

value.name: pressure test -- form leak off test
value.description: A specialization of 'pressure test': formation leak off test

value.name: rig move -- jack up or down
rig up or tear down -- rig up
value.description: A specialization of 'rig up or tear down'.

value.name: rig up or tear down -- site work
value.description: A specialization of 'rig up or tear down'.

value.name: rig up or tear down -- tear down
value.description: A specialization of 'rig up or tear down'.v

value.name: run or pull riser -- other
value.description: A specialization of 'run or pull riser'.

value.name: run or pull riser -- run or pull riser
value.description: A specialization of 'run or pull riser'.

value.name: testing general
value.description: Testing of any nature, if more detail is not known.

value.name: testing general -- equipment
value.description: A specialization of 'testing general'. Testing of surface equipment, or downhole equipment tested at surface.

value.name: testing general -- flow
value.description: A specialization of 'testing general'. Well Flow testing, in the pre-production phase of the well.

value.name: well srvc -- clean well to compl fluid
well srvc -- install or test xmas tree
well srvc -- land, set, test completion
value.description: A specialization of 'well srvc': land, set and test completion

value.name: well srvc -- suspend well or pull BOPs
wireline logs -- form tester
value.description: A specialization of 'wireline logs': formation tester

enumList.name: LithologyType
enumList.description: These values represent the lithological terminology used in descriptions of rock cuttings in mud logs.

value.name: andesite
value.description: Intermediate porphyritic volcanic rock consisting of plagioclase, pyroxene, hornblende and bitotite.

value.name: anhydrite
value.description: The mineral form of anhydrous calcium sulfate, commonly massive in evaporite beds.

value.name: arkose
value.description: An indurated arenaceous deposit consisting chiefly of quartz and feldspar (>25%).

value.name: basalt
value.description: Volcanic rock consisting essentially of plagioclase feldspar and pyroxene.

value.name: breccia
value.description: A lithified rock rich in angular fragments of size greater than 2mm.

value.name: calcarenite
value.description: A limestone more than half of which consists of cemented sand-size grains of calcium carbonate: a consolidated calcareous sand.

value.name: calcilutite
value.description: A limestone more than half of which consists of detrital calcite particles of silt and/or clay size: a consolidated calcareous mud.

value.name: calcisiltite
value.description: A limestone more than half of which consists of detrital calcite particles of silt size: a consolidated calcareous silt.

value.name: chalk
value.description: A fine-grained limestone composed largely of coccolith fragments.

value.name: chert
value.description: Siliceous sedimentary rock containing finely crystalline snd fibrous quartz.

value.name: clay
value.description: Unconsolidated deposit of very fine particles of size generally less than 1/256mm and composed of clay minerals.

value.name: claystone
value.description: An indurated clay, lacking the fissility of shale.

value.name: coal
value.description: A combustible organic sedimentary rock with less than 40% of mineral matter (based on dry material) composed of polymers of cyclic hydrocarbons.

value.name: conglomerate
value.description: An indurated sedimentary rock containing an essential quantity of rounded rock fragments larger than 2mm, and normally having a matrix of sand.

value.name: diabase
value.description: Igneous rock of grain size intermediate between basalt and gabbro composed of plagioclase feldspar, pyroxene and opaque minerals. Synonym: dolerite.

value.name: diorite
value.description: Plutonic igneous rock consisting of plagioclase feldspar, commonly with hornblende and biotite.

value.name: dolomite
value.description: Sedimentary rock containing more than 90% dolomite (mineral) and less than 10% calcite.

value.name: dolomite, calcareous
value.description: A dolomite rock containing more than 10% calcite.

value.name: extrusive rock (volcanic)
value.description: Igneous rocks formed by solidification of material erupted sub-aerially or sub-aqueously onto the earth's surface, as either lava flows or pyroclastic material.

value.name: feldspar
value.description: The family of aluminium silicates of sodium, potassium, calcium and other metals which comprise over 60% of the earth's crust, are the most abundant mineral group, and occur in all types of rocks.

value.name: gabbro
value.description: Coarse grained plutonic igneous rock composed essentially of calcic plagioclase feldspar, pyroxenes and iron oxide.

value.name: glauconite
value.description: A mineral composed of ferrous potassium silicates related to mica which commonly imparts a green color to its sedimentary host rock.

value.name: gneiss
value.description: A metamorphic rock, commonly foliated and crystalline, whose mineral content can range from quartz and feldspars to amphiboles and pyroxenes.

value.name: granite
value.description: Coarse grained plutonic rock typically containing free quartz, alkali feldspar and biotite mica.

value.name: gravel
value.description: An unconsolidated deposit of coarse clastics. The diameters on the Wenworth scale are generally greater than 2mm.

value.name: greenstones
value.description: A field term for any dark fine grained altered or metamorphosed basic igneous rock.

value.name: greywacke
value.description: A dark grey consolidated deposit containing feldspar, rock fragments and a dark chloritic matrix.

value.name: gumbo
value.description: A term used in the U.S. for clay soils that become sticky, impervious, and plastic when wet.

value.name: gypsum
value.description: A mineral composed of hydrous calcium sulphate, commonly forming thick extensive evaporite beds.

value.name: halite
value.description: A mineral composed of sodium chloride common in evaporite rocks.

value.name: igneous
value.description: Term applied to rock or mineral formed by solidification of molten or partly molten material (magma).

value.name: intrusvie rock (plutonic)
value.description: Igneous rock formed by cooling and solidification of magma within the earth's crust.

value.name: limestone
value.description: A sedimentary rock composed mostly of the mineral calcite (calcium carbonate) which is the consolidated equivalent of lime mud, calcareous sand, and/or shell fragments.

value.name: limestone, argillaceous
value.description: A limestone homogeneously mixed with 10-50% clay minerals.

value.name: limestone, dolomitic
value.description: A limestone containing 10-50% dolomite and 50-90% calcite.

value.name: limestone, sandy
value.description: A limestone homogeneously mixed with 10-50% quartz grains.

value.name: marble
value.description: A metamorphic rock composed of calcite.

value.name: marl
value.description: A consolidated or semi-consolidated mixture of clay and generally fine grained carbonate material.

value.name: metamorphic rocks
value.description: Rocks formed by mineralogical, chemical and structural alteration of pre-existing rocks under conditions of temperature and pressure at depth in the earth.

value.name: ophiolite
value.description: Basic and ultra-basic igneous rocks and their metamorposed, often hydrated, derivatives, believed to represent former oceanic crust.

value.name: peat
value.description: Unconsolidated, semi-carbonised plant remains which are a precursor of humic coal.

value.name: phosphate
value.description: Any mineral compound containing the ((PO4)3) radical.

value.name: phosphate rock
value.description: Any rock containing phosphate minerals such as apatite of sufficient purity and abundance to be an economic resource.

value.name: potassium and magnesium salts
value.description: Salts such as sylvinite, carnalite, keiserite with swelling properties that can severely obstruct drilling operations.

value.name: quartzite
value.description: A sedimentary rock composed of more than 95% of quartz.

value.name: rhyolite
value.description: Silica rich volcanic rock consisting of quartz and alkali feldspar with minor plagioclase and biotite.

value.name: salt
value.description: Common term for naturally occurring sodium chloride.

value.name: sand
value.description: An aggregation of particles having diameters in the range 1/16mm to 2mm usually consisting of quartz.

value.name: sandstone
value.description: A sedimentary rock composed of indurated sand.

value.name: schist
value.description: A strongly foliated crystalline metamorphic rock.

value.name: serpentine
value.description: A rock forming mineral of hydrous iron and magnesium silicates, often resulting from metamorhism of amphiboles and pyroxenes.

value.name: shale
value.description: A fine-grained sedimentary rock formed by the compaction of clay, silt or mud.

value.name: silt
value.description: Unconsolidated sedimentary material with grain sizes between 1/16mm and 1/256mm.

value.name: slate
value.description: A compact fine-grained metamorphic rock displaying slaty cleavage along which the rock may be cut into sheets.

value.name: syenite
value.description: Plutonic igneous rock composed essentially of alkali feldspar, with lesser sodic plagioclase, biotite and hornblende, and minor quartz.

value.name: tillite (diamictite)
value.description: Consolidated unsorted glacial deposits with particles ranging from boulder to mud in grain size and of highly variable composition.

value.name: trachyte
value.description: A group of fine-grained often porphyritic volcanic rocks containing alkali feldspar and minor mafic minerals.

value.name: tuff
value.description: An indurated pyroclastic deposit, predominantly consisting of fine-grained volcanic rocks: sedimentary particles may be present. Tuff may be deposited sub-aerially or sub-aqueously, and may be well sorted or heterogeneous.

value.name: ultrabasic
value.description: A class of igneous rocks composed mostly of mafic minerals such as pyroxenes along with calcic feldspar, with no free silica and a total silica content less than about 45%.

value.name: undifferentiated
value.description: The lithology is not differentiated. This is typically used to fill out a lithology description to 100 percent.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: QualifierType
enumList.description: These values represent the type of qualifier in lithology.

value.name: anhydritic
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains anhydrite

value.name: argillaceous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has a clay content

value.name: barite
value.description: The mineral form of Barium sulphate.

value.name: belemnitic
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains belemnite fossils or fragments thereof.

value.name: bioturbated
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has been disturbed by organisms before consolidation.

value.name: bituminous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains bituminous material

value.name: bryozoans
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains bryozoan fossils or fragments thereof.

value.name: burrowed
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has been disturbed by burrowing organisms before consolidation

value.name: calcareous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has a calcite content

value.name: calcite concr
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has calcite concretions

value.name: carbonaceous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains carbonaceous material

value.name: chalky
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has a chalk content

value.name: chamosite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains chamosite

value.name: chert
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains chert fragments

value.name: chlorite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains chlorite

value.name: concretions
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains concretions

value.name: conglomeratic
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains conglomerate rock material.

value.name: coral
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains corals and/or coral fragments

value.name: crinoids
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains crinoids and/or crinoid fragments

value.name: diatoms
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains diatoms and/or diatom fragments

value.name: dolomite concretion
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has dolomite concretions

value.name: dolomite stringer
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains thin beds or veins of dolomite

value.name: dolomitic
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has a dolomite content

value.name: dolomite
value.description: A rock forming mineral composed of calcium-magnesium carbonate (CaMg(CO3)2).

value.name: feldspar
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains feldspar

value.name: ferruginous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains minerals rich in iron oxide or iron hydroxide

value.name: fissile
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology is fissile

value.name: forams undifferentiated
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains foraminifera

value.name: fossil fragment
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains fossil fragments

value.name: fossils undifferentiated
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains fossils

value.name: glauconite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains glauconite granules

value.name: glauconitic
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology is glauconitic

value.name: gravelly
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains gravel sized particles.

value.name: gypsiferous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains significant gypsum content.

value.name: halite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains halite

value.name: illite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains the clay mineral illite

value.name: kaolinite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains kaolinite

value.name: lignite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains lignite

value.name: limestone stringer
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains thin beds or veins of limestone

value.name: lithic fragment
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains other rock fragments

value.name: marly
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains marl

value.name: mica
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains mica

value.name: microfossil
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains undifferentiated microfossils

value.name: oncolite
value.description: A rock composed of stacked oncoliths

value.name: oncolith
value.description: A hemispheroidal mass of calcified algal laminae surrounding a mud fragment

value.name: oncolithic
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains oncolites

value.name: ooid or oolith
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains ooids (synonym: ooliths)

value.name: ostracods
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains ostracod fossils

value.name: pebbly
value.description: Indicates that the associated material contains pebble sized particles.

value.name: pelletal
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains pellets or fragments of pellets.

value.name: pellet
value.description: A round or rounded particle generally less than 10mm in diameter, not formed by rounding of detrital material.

value.name: peloid
value.description: A small particle of carbonate mineral in which individual crystals are too small to be distinguished either by the naked eye or under a polarizing microscope (less than 0.001mm).

value.name: peloidal
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains peloids.

value.name: phosphate
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains phosphates

value.name: pisolite
value.description: A sedimentary rock mainly consisting of pisoliths

value.name: pisolith
value.description: A sub-spherical body usually consisting of calcium carbonate, generally of length greater than 2mm

value.name: plant remains
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains plant remains

value.name: pyrite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains pyrite

value.name: quartz
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains quartz

value.name: radiolaria
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains radiolaria

value.name: salty
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains rock salt or halite

value.name: sandy
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has a sand content

value.name: shell
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains shell fragments

value.name: siderite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains siderite

value.name: siderite concretion
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains siderite concretions

value.name: silty
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has a silt content

value.name: spicule
value.description: A minute needle-like body of quartz or carbonate that forms part of skeletons of animals such as sponges, corals and radiolarians.

value.name: spicular
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains spicules.

value.name: stylolite
value.description: A small, more or less columnar, striated extension of a rock body that fits into a corresponding surface, common in carbonate rocks.

value.name: stylolitic
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains stylolites.

value.name: tuffaceous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains pyroclastic detrital material (tuff).

value.name: tuffite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains both pyroclastic and other detrital material.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: RealtimeData
enumList.description: These values represent the name of a recording channel.

value.name: length along fiber
value.description: The position along the length of a DTS fiber.

value.name: DTS temperature
value.description: The temperature that was calculated from Distributed Temperature Survey data.

value.name: Stokes intensity
value.description: Stokes intensity values from a Distributed Temperature Survey.

value.name: anti-Stokes intensity
value.description: Anti-Stokes intensity values from a Distributed Temperature Survey.

value.name: cementing ECD at casing shoe
value.description: Cementing effective circulating density at casing shoe

value.name: cementing plugs
value.description: Cementing number and status of plugs

value.name: conductivity of mud out (average)
value.description: Mud conductivity coming out of the hole

value.name: cost per distance (average)
value.description: Cost per distance averaged over the bit run

value.name: cumulative time on bit
value.description: Number of drilling hours on the bit

value.name: ECD at bit depth
value.description: Effective circulating density at bit depth

value.name: ECD at total depth
value.description: Equivalent circulating density at total depth

value.name: flow in (relative)
value.description: Flow into the hole measured as a percentage

value.name: flow rate out (average)
value.description: Mud flow out of the hole

value.name: flow out (relative)
value.description: Flow out of hole measured as a percentage

value.name: hookload (minimum)
value.description: Minimum hookload while running the stand

value.name: measured depth of casing
value.description: Measured depth of casing in the cementing

value.name: measured depth of DST bottom
value.description: Depth (measured) of bottom of DST interval

value.name: measured depth of DST top
value.description: Depth (measured) of top of DST interval

value.name: hydraulic power per area of bit
rotation flag
value.description: Rotation flag = 1 if pipe is rotating, else = 0

value.name: rotary speed (average)
value.description: Rotary speed, measured at surface (revs per minute)

value.name: state of well
value.description: State of well during DST (SHUT-IN or FLOWING)

value.name: mud temperature out (average)
value.description: Mud temperature coming out of the hole

value.name: torque (average)
value.description: Rotary torque, average, measured at surface

value.name: torque (maximum)
value.description: Rotary torque, maximum, measured at surface

value.name: TVD of casing
value.description: TVD of casing in the cementing context

value.name: TVD of DST bottom
value.description: Depth (vertical) of bottom of DST interval

value.name: TVD of DST top
value.description: Depth (vertical) of top of DST interval

value.name: weight on bit (average)
value.description: Weight on bit, measured at surface

value.name: weight on bit (maximum)
value.description: Weight on bit, maximum, measured at surface

value.name: mud density in (average)
value.description: Mud density going into the hole

value.name: mud density out (average)
value.description: Mud density coming out of the hole

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: NameTagLocation
enumList.description: Defines the locations where an equipment tag might be found.

value.name: body
value.description: The body of the equipment. For tubular components this specifies a location toward the middle of the component.

value.name: box
value.description: The female threaded end of a device.

value.name: pin
value.description: The male threaded end of a device.

value.name: other
value.description: This, by exclusion, tells a user to look elsewhere than on the body or near the ends of a component.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: NameTagNumberingScheme
enumList.description: Defines the specifications for creating equipment tags.

value.name: MSRCID
value.description: RFID - Merrick Systems Rapid Component Identification.

value.name: ANSI/AIM-BC6
value.description: Barcode - 1995, Uniform Symbology Multi Row Specification

value.name: MFM
value.description: Magnetic - "Modified Frequency Modulation for Magnetic Stripes" standard developed by AIM Inc.

value.name: serial number
value.description: Serial number contains a code which does not require any further knowledge of an encoding scheme to manipulate or process. The identifier is the only information in the "tag".

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: NameTagTechnology
enumList.description: Defines the mechanisms for attaching an equipment tag to an item.

value.name: tagged
value.description: Independent identification components attached or embedded to a larger component for purposes of identification of the larger component. Tags typically use electronic, radio or sound based technologies and that require a special non-optical device to read them. Radio Frequency Identification (RFID tags) are of this type, as are some magnetic and sound based identification technologies.

value.name: labeled
value.description: An optical label attached to a component. The label may be glued, riveted or attached by some other method and may contain a serial number, barcode or other optically recognized information. Note that a label may possibly have a combination of identifiers associated with it, such as a serial number, a barcode and an embedded RFID identifier. This would generate three nameTags for the one physical label, two of type 'label' for the barcode and serial number and one of type 'tagged' for the RFID identifier.

value.name: intrinsic
value.description: Identification technologies where the intrinsic properties of the component to be identified contain the identification information and no other unique code has been added. For example, some magnetic identification technologies use grooves machined into a component. Some components may also be identified, for example, by their individual sonic signature or optical profile.

value.name: stamped
value.description: An identification code physically stamped into the base material of the component to be identified. Note that if a serial number is stamped into a label attached to a component, 'labeled' should be used and not 'stamped'. Stamped identifiers can wear off but can not fall off.

value.name: painted
value.description: Painted or stenciled on the material.

value.name: temporary
value.description: Temporary identification codes marked with grease pencil, chalk, or such.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.
